page.title: 05SCHOOLS IN RAMSGATE
page.content: Locally the education system is still based on selection at 11 for grammar or secondary school.In our area,Chilton is mixed junior & infants,Priory Road is an infant school & Christ Church is a junior school.When the children reach the age of 11,they take a test & the results,when taken with other criteria, decide the 25% who shall go to grammar schools.In this area is Clarendon House Girls Grammar School.Other Grammar schools are Chatham House Boys & Dane Court. Generally children start school at the age of 5 and leave at 16. The basic subjects are Mathematics and English,but increasing emphasis is now being put on science,environmental studies and computers.Most primary schools have at least one computer and eventually there will be one in every classroom.Costs are rather high at the moment but parents help financially.
